Text:
The next thing Alexia knows, she is standing in a
white corridor.

It is a hazy space that feels real, yet also something
like a dream.
Where are we?
This is Olivier's memory, cast into the Sanctuary.

The Cult once gathered orphaned children here to use
as subjects in a certain experiment.

Most of the children were incompatible with "it" and
died.
All that remained were a handful of girls.

Before them is a girl covered in blood. However, it
is not simply from her own self-inflicted wounds.
Blood drips from where her skin has split due to
some bizarre mutation of her body.

Alexia has seen this type of black, rotting state
before.
This is...possession?!
How cruel...
Alpha starts to walk.
There was a common thread in the children's deaths.

Girls fell victim to the possession while boys did
not.
Alpha stops before a particular cell.
Beyond the glass is a young Olivier.

She is unharmed and doesn't appear to be in any pain.
She merely stares at the cell across from her.

The other cell is a gory mess. Then, in what seems
like a sudden change of scene, the blood is swept
away and a girl appears inside.

She then dies in agony. Another girl takes her place
immediately.
And little Olivier just keeps on watching.
Olivier was one of the few who could adapt to "it".
And exactly what is this "it"?

Diablos cells...or at least that's what we call them.
The Cult was implanting demonic cells into the
children.

They had no choice. They needed power in order to
combat Diablos.
That was the Cult's excuse.

Regardless of the truth, there is no denying that
Olivier did indeed sever the demon's left arm.
So it wasn't just a fairy tale?
You're free to think that way if you wish.

In the end, we can't tell how much of what we're
seeing here is real.
Memories fade over time.

They can be reshaped according to their owner's
wishes.

Olivier grows into a lovely young woman. The striking
resemblance between her and Alpha is undeniable.

In any event, once Olivier had the power of Diablos,
she was given a mission.
Slaying Diablos?

So the story goes, but her true mission was to
harvest more Diablos cells.
What nonsense...!
...Gaargh

Olivier still obeyed the Cult even after obtaining her
newfound strength. She had faith that a peaceful
future for the people lay ahead…
But the Cult had different ideas.
The world comes apart like a mirror shattering
and is replaced by a new one.

Now they stand on a battlefield littered with mounds
of corpses.
Alexia and the others follow Alpha.
What is that...?

The dark mass is a gigantic arm―the thick, black,
hideously swollen appendage of a monster. It has
long, sharp claws with fresh bits of flesh stuck to
them.
The left arm of Diablos.

Though severed, the arm is still alive. A hapless man
finds himself impaled on its bone when he approaches
it carelessly.

The Cult used a high-grade ancient artifact to seal
away the arm.

But this seal was imperfect and eventually produced
distortions that became the Sanctuary. But that's a
whole other story.

The Cult's true interest was the incredible life
energy contained within Diablos cells.

They carved up its flesh and drew blood from it to
study so that they might gain this vitality for
themselves...
These are the fruits of that process.
Those are...!
Alexia has seen those red tablets before.
But these pills had powerful side effects
and were not truly what the Cult sought.

The world shatters, falling into fragments like a
broken mirror once more.
